p: Phage display has been employed to screen peptide inhibitors of HIV-1 assembly ( Sticht et al., 2005). A commercial library of M13-derived phages presenting random 12-amino-acid peptides was analyzed for specific binding to purified CA or CA-NC proteins. The specifically bound phages were sequenced, and corresponding peptides were chemically synthesized and re-tested in an in vitro assembly assay ( Gross et al., 2000).
